page.title: 09ARMED FORCES/TOURISM-AIR DAY
page.content: Air Day is put on at Culdrose every year, usually in July.There are air displays like the "Sharks"helicopter display team which uses Gazelle helicopters to do all sorts of aerobatics.There is usually a Search and Rescue display to show how people are rescued from cliffs and ships by winches.Visitors to Air Day can get winched up in a hangar. Sometimes old aircraft are flown and modern aeroplanes are on show. Sometimes there is a fair and a selection of stalls by the hanger. Near the runway there are sweet stalls,toy stalls and food stalls. The main attraction is the Red Arrows who do aerobatics and formation flying over the airfield. Air Day is a very popular occasion and it is always packed out with visitors.
